alert.note: Alert for Bee; Duval; Live Oak; McMullen (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 5:12AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Duval, southeastern McMullen, Live Oak and northwestern Bee Counties through 545 AM CDT... At 511 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles north of Esseville to near Choke Canyon to 11 miles southeast of Tilden to 6 miles northwest of Loma Alta to 15 miles east of Fort Ewell Site. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Freer, George West, Three Rivers, Choke Canyon, Seven Sisters, Loma Alta, Calliham, Nell, Karon, Oakville, Pawnee, Simmons, Ray Point, Esseville, Whitsett and Clegg. This includes the following highways... Interstate 37 between mile markers 59 and 83. US Highway 281 between mile markers 618 and 638. US Highway 59 between mile markers 718 and 770. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
